The BMW R1200GS and R1200GS Adventure are motorcycles manufactured in Berlin, Germany by BMW Motorrad, part of the BMW group. It is one of the BMW GS family of dual sport motorcycles. Both motorcycles have a 1,170 cc (71 cu in), two-cylinder boxer engine with 4-valves per cylinder.

The BMW R1200GS and R1200GS Adventure are motorcycles manufactured in Berlin, Germany by BMW Motorrad, part of the BMW group. It is one of the BMW GS family of dual sport motorcycles. Both motorcycles have a 1,170 cc (71 cu in), two-cylinder boxer engine with 4-valve heads.

BMW motorcycles are motorcycles manufactured by BMW Motorrad, part of the BMW group.
The BMW R1200GS is a dual-sport motorcycle that was introduced in 2004 by BMW Motorrad to replace the R1150GS model.
The BMW R 1200 GS is a dual-sport motorcycle that was introduced in 2004 by BMW Motorrad to replace the R 1150 GS model.
BMW motorcycles include the GS adventure touring series, S1000RR sportbike, R1200RT sport touring, R nineT naked bike, C650GT scooter and C evolution electric scooter.

The BMW S1000RR is a sport bike initially made by BMW Motorrad to compete in the 2009 Superbike World Championship, that is now in commercial production. It was introduced in Munich in April 2008, and is powered by a 999 cc (61.0 cu in) four-cylinder engine redlined at 14,200 rpm.

The gas tank is a container for storing volatile flammable liquids.

A fuel tank (or petrol tank) is a safe container for flammable fluids.

A fuel tank is a safe container for flammable fluids. Though any storage tank for fuel may be so called, the term is typically applied to part of an engine system in which the fuel is stored and propelled or released (pressurized gas) into an engine.

A motorcycle, often called a bike, motorbike, or cycle, is a two- or three-wheeled motor vehicle. Motorcycle design varies greatly to suit a range of different purposes: long distance travel, commuting, cruising, sport including racing, and off-road riding.
The motorcycle is a two-wheeled motor vehicle. They are very popular in South Asia, East Asia, Southeast Asia, Latin America, Europe and parts of North America.
